info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 10 at 9:03PM MDT until October 10 at 10:15PM MDT by NWS Salt Lake City UT
info.description:
At 903 PM MDT, Washington County Emergency Management and Dispatch reported significant flooding and debris flows in Pine Valley that originated from the Forsyth Burn Scar. The USGS gage on the Santa Clara near Pine Valley has reported a rise from 1.5 feet to just over 9 feet. Between 0.75 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible over the next 30 minutes in the warned area as an additional thunderstorm has moved over the burn scar. Flash flooding is already occurring.
The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Forsyth Burn Scar.
SOURCE...Washington County Emergency Management
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Forsyth Burn Scar.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pine Valley.
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Forsyth Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE FORSYTH BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTY
